Posts.Content: blzzrdqueen wrote: Hi everyone, I just found this site...wanted to share and introduce myself.  My name is Jen, I'm 30 years old, married and mom of two girls, ages 12 and 3.  There is absolutly no history of breast cancer in my family but my husband's brother's wife is a survivor, for 2 years now.  I do breast exams monthly, sometimes more often.  Lsat month I found a small lump just to the right of my nipple and areola on my right breast.  The lump is about the size of a pea, and feels like it is under some ripply tissue.  I wanted to wait for my period to come and go to see if it changed with it but it did not.  It's also sore...like tender..  I will be calling my primary doctor this morning to make a appointment.  I really don't think it is anything to worry about, but I still can't help but be scared and wonder if it is cancer.  I tel myself I am too young, but I know age is not a factor.  So far just my husband and my mother know I found the lump.  I had my husband feel for the lump and feel my other breast to feel the difference and he says there is definetly a lump there.  I will let you all know when I get my appt with my doctor and what happens.  Just wanted to find a place where I could talk about my fears.  Thanks for listening. Jen Edited to note that I called my primary and she is no longer taking my insurance!!!  So now I have to find a new primary doctor, but for this I am going to see my ob/gyn.  I wanted to go to someone I know and trust instead of my initial visit being with a complete stranger... Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: First time finding a lump... blzzrdqueen K-Lo

Posts.Content: Aug 16, 2011 01:22PM blzzrdqueen wrote: Going to my OB/GYN in a half hour for my first check on this lump.  Nervous, scared, but hopeful it's nothing.  Don't know what to expect...he has the ability to do ultrasound right in the office, so I hope he opts to do that first...no idea if he'll require a mammogram...wish me luck!
Posts.Title: First time finding a lump... blzzrdqueen K-Lo

Posts.Content: Aug 16, 2011 04:35PM blzzrdqueen wrote: He sent me across the street for a breast ultrasound, but they will not do it without a mammogram first.  I go for both tomorrow at 9am.  I've never had a mammo before.
Posts.Title: First time finding a lump... blzzrdqueen K-Lo

Posts.Content: Aug 17, 2011 04:05PM blzzrdqueen wrote: I ended up with just the ultrasound after all.  I'm not at all pleased with the appointment.  I was made to feel rushed and uncared for, and this is from a dedicated breast center!!  After the tech scanning for a total of 60 seconds and showing the radiologist, she came back saying it was "just" normal breast tissue.  I'm still very uneasy about the whole thing so I'm going to wait a few weeks, and if it still hasn't changed or gets bigger I will seek a second opinion. Thanks for asking!!
Posts.Title: First time finding a lump... blzzrdqueen K-Lo
